attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Both these categories of people cheat hard-working tax-payers yet it is legal to be a "non-dom" whereas it is not legal to be a benefit "thief".  Why this difference?  One specific "non-dom" who has been in the news recently has apparently deprived the Exchequer of £127 million; how many benefit "thieves" would it take to get to that amount?  Either it should be illegal to be a "non-dom" or it should be legal to be a benefit "thief".
